page.title: 10Leisure in Laggan
page.content: Most of the villagers in Laggan enjoy the activities which take place in the new village hall (see social life in Laggan). As well as organised leasure, most people have their own pastimes. Many men enjoy wood-craft and fishing, while women knit and bake - sometimes for country fair competitons. Reading is a popular recreational activity and we are supplied by a fortnightly library van which travels from Fort William. The population follows a wide selection of hobbies. The natural facilities are well used for fishing, pony trekking, hill walking, nordic skiing, and bird watching. Choirs and folk music are well supported. Ceilidh dances are a happy family event when impromptu party pieces are performed to allow a rest from rigourous country dances.
